entries.author: clarissa_shen
entries.text: There are 2 tracks in the competition: 'Scene Classification Challenge' and a 'Human Skeletal System Keypoints Detection Challenge'. Go for it!
entries.title: Introducing AI Challenger, a $300,000 Global AI Competition for Students

entries.author: dave_elliman
entries.text: Traditional perimeter defenses isn't enough. One needs to think about all the cycle of Prevention -> Detection -> Response -> Recovery -> and then back to more and better Prevention.
entries.title: A lean model for security and security practices

entries.author: john_nicol
entries.text: Looking at flame-graphs and finding the 'hot' methods by mapping the graph to the actual source code. There are a number of specific areas in Java programming (and probably in other languages as well) that are repeatedly the source of slow execution. Finding these and finding a commonly used solution for these can be a win to the company.
entries.title: Common Issue Detection for CPU Profiling

entries.author: dale_mcdiarmid
entries.text: Out of the box experimenting with the whole ElasticSearch stack including Kibana on a Docker image. Get the layout of the whole system including the web servers, the RDBMS, the logging system, etc.
entries.title: A full stack in One Command

entries.author: andrew_powell_morse
entries.text: Short list: out of the box ES6 module support and mobile device throttling to WebUSB API support and storage usage statistics. Apparently Chrome has 55% market share.
entries.title: New Development Tools in Chrome 61

header: Do you know a student who would like to get $300,000 for looking at pictures? I know it is a bit more involved than that, but still.
subject: Try ElasticSearch in a single Docker
